alert.note: Alert for Eastern Addison; Western Addison (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 4:59PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Addison County through 600 PM EDT... At 458 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Middlebury, moving northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Middlebury, Vergennes, Ferrisburg, Weybridge, Waltham, Bristol, Monkton Ridge, Lincoln, Monkton, Monkton Boro, New Haven, Panton, Ripton, Cornwall, Starksboro, Ferrisburgh, Salisbury, Addison, East Middlebury, and West Lincoln. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
